subject: PRO X ULTRA: Inconsistent Brake
description_text:
G'day,

I'm having some trouble with my brake pedal, and I'm hoping you can help.
The input isn't consistent; about 80% of the time, it registers full
braking power with the same amount of pressure, but occasionally it reads
half, three-quarters, or nothing at all.

I've already tried grounding the box to the rig and attempting to remove
any electromagnetic interference (EMI). I've also searched online to see if
anyone else has experienced similar issues, but I haven't found any similar
cases.

I'd prefer not to return the pedal if possible, as it would be quite a
hassle. Is there anything I can do to fix this issue?

Thanks,
Toby

conversations.body_text: Braking Video     I'll also attach this. This is a video of me attempting to braking consistently 0-100%. I was using the same amount of pressure the whole time. You can see at the end that it starts behaving normally again.

Hi Toby Harrison,     Could you please provide a photo of the side view of the brake damper so that I can confirm whether it is installed correctly? Also, please check if there is any bracket interference or contact beneath the brake sensor. In addition, could you let me know which wheel base you are using?

G'day,

Here are the photos of the brake damper from the side. It looks like it's
installed correctly, but I'm not sure. I'm using the MOZA R3 wherlbase

Cheers,
Toby

On Mon, 18 Aug 2025, 10:12 pm service@simsonn.com,

Hi Toby Harrison,  This is a photo of the front of the brake. I also need a photo of the brake side plate. It’s possible that the damping preload nut on the brake was not properly adjusted, resulting in insufficient reset force.

G'day

Sorry for the delayed response and for forgetting to attach the other photo
in my previous email.

I've attached a few photos this time from various angles to ensure you have
all the views you need.





On Tue, 19 Aug 2025, 2:03 pm service@simsonn.com,

Hi Toby Harrison,  Please use the test version 2.1.1, click Revert → Save, and then recalibrate and test again. If the issue persists, you may try refreshing the firmware manually: go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware-proxultra.sfu to upgrade. For now, please avoid using version 2.1.0—we will release an online update soon.      https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UPkeOHREyALtCtNmL87a2WnUDZV0Gx_b/view?usp=drive_link

G'day,

I'll proceed with the firmware update as suggested.

In the meantime, I also tried swapping the USB port the pedal was plugged
into. It was previously in one of the fastest speed ports on my
motherboard, and I've now moved it to a standard USB port. This has
improved the consistency somewhat, though I still occasionally get a random
low output.

Hopefully, with this change and the firmware update, the issue will be
fully resolved. I'll provide another update tomorrow.

Cheers


On Wed, 20 Aug 2025, 11:49 pm service@simsonn.com,
Hi Toby Harrison,  Alternatively, you may consider using a USB 3.0 hub with independent power supply.
